com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.keycolumnvalue

Class BufferTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.keycolumnvalue.BufferTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StoreTransaction, TransactionHandle

    public class BufferTransaction
extends Object
implements StoreTransaction
    Buffers mutations against multiple KeyColumnValueStore from the same storage backend for increased write performance. The buffer size (i.e. number of mutations after which to flush) is configurable.

    A BufferTransaction also attempts to flush multiple times in the event of temporary storage failures for increased write robustness.

    Author:
    Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHandle
        Forces all buffered writes to be sent to underlying storage. It is not necessary or meaningful to call this method on a TransactionHandle instance after calling TransactionHandle.commit() or TransactionHandle.rollback() on the instance.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface TransactionHandle
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHandle
        Commits the transaction. This implies a TransactionHandle.flush(). Call either this method or TransactionHandle.rollback() at most once per instance.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface TransactionHandle
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionHandle
        Aborts (or rolls back) the transaction. Call either this method or TransactionHandle.commit() at most once per instance.
        Specified by:
